group.headline: Unofficial GMOD Steam group!
group.summary:
We like building stuff. Some of us like destroying it. Some of us like destroying things others created. Some of us like to laugh at the others whose things got ravaged just to cry shortly after since our own creations are on the ground burning up in ashes. Some of us like banning both parties from the same playing field. And a select few of us are locked away in their basements coding tools in a weird moon computer language.
No matter who you are, you'll fit in good. It's a world of possibilities, assholes and unstable Windows dedicated servers out there, and you have to be part of it. If not you can just add baloons to airboats.


Plus it contributes to the income of some random British guy (and his team of coding monkeys). Can you name one thing about that last sentance that just didn't feel right to you?
Join today, and feel the burn tomorrow!

group.headline: Fortress Forever - A Team Fortress Mod for Half-Life 2
group.summary: Fortress Forever is a Team Fortress mod for Half-life 2's Source Engine. Our independent team has created this mod entirely from scratch.Fortress Forever retains the classic staples, such as unique class based gameplay around a wide variety of weapons and grenades while expanding on the depth and fast flowing gameplay that team fortress fans have come to love. Fortress Forever should please those who have stuck with or been a part Half-life: TFC over the years while at the same time doing more for new TF players than any prior Fortress attempt.The game is free to those who purchase Half-life 2 or have a source package with source sdk base.

group.headline: Steam's sneakiest group, the world's number one PC gaming magazine.
group.summary:
This is the buzzing, twitching nerve centre of our many-tendrilled games-playing monster.







In our chatroom, you'll be kicked or temporarily banned if you:

- Are a dick.
- Give away SPOILERZ!
- Actively promote piracy in any way (e.g. giving out names of sites, asking for links to be PM'ed)
-Complain excessively about things unrelated to and unfixable by PC Gamer. An example being TF2 updates.
-Ask for games to be gifted to you or engage in account trading
-Spam group or pm invites
-Link any undesirable content.

And perma-banned if you:

- Spam
- Link a site containing illegal torrents, downloads or other forms of piracy
- Do something we've previously kicked or temporarily banned you for
- Return with an alt account
- Use racist, sexist, homophobic or Xenophobic language.

Please note: None of the community moderators of the PCG Chat have administrator rights to the PCG TF2 Server or any PCG gameservers. If you wish to report cheaters, hackers, abuse etc then take a screenshot of the incident, get the SteamID of the offender, by typing status into the in-game developer console (enable in advanced keyboard options, open with the ` key to the left of the 1 key) and send an email to one of the PCG writers with the screenshot and SteamID so they can take action.

group.headline: Team Fortress 2 Community Evaluation Group
group.summary:
Welcome to the Worlds Largest Team Fortress 2 Steam community by www.AFWarehouse.com and www.AFNation.com

The purpose of this group is to help all Team Fortress 2 players find the perfect community and servers to become part of . And to promote the good TF2 communities that are out there. AFWarehouse.com and AFNation.com teams will send out staff to visit and maybe even join communities to evaluate their members, rules, and server quality.

Know ahead of time which servers will make you feel welcome, exhibit player teamwork, respect players, or promote player abuse.

When our evaluation is complete, we will write up the evaluation for all players to view. There is nothing worse than expending time and energy into a community, only to find out that your donated funds were used to pay for someones supercomputer , when you thought you were supporting a community.

We will publish events from the good communities so that you will be notified when something is going on through our events notification system.

Communities that would like to be evaluated, email your community website address to support@afwarehouse.com

group.headline: Welcome with arms open fellow gamers!
group.summary:
Yay the first furry group on steam!

A group where furs from all around the globe can gather under one roof and chat/play games/meet one another and have a good time.


Chatroom Rules: They are simple to follow so please do so. Ignorance of the rules is not an excuse.

First and foremost, as both a warning and rule: This chat has an R rating. In other words, mature subjects are acceptable, BUT there should be no "yiff" in chat. This includes explicitly teasing someone else or giving a play by play of how you did this and that to someone the other night. On to the rest of the rules!

1.No Drama (To an extent, of course.) ^^
2.No Griefing/Trolling.
3.Posting links is fine, but if it contains not safe for work (NSFW) content, then it should be specified with the link in the SAME message as the link, please.
4.No Racism.
5.Respect Mods, Admins and one another.
6.No spamming. (Voice/Text)
7.No flaming of other users/members. Be civil and show respect.
8.No advertising for other Steam Communities, servers, clans, or for anything that isn't directly related to Furry Pride. (Ask NaV-PoD if unsure.)
9.No links to browser bombs or other malicious web sites.
10.No bashing other groups in the chatroom (It will make us no better than them.)

Seems like a lot but it all comes down to common sense, if its used then there will be no issues and we can all be happy and have a good time. :F

group.headline: Is it sabotage? An accident? Or is it something you did?
group.summary:
Half-Life: Source is the original game but imported into the new Source engine. It isn't an extensive overhaul like Counter-Strike. It is more of a direct port so the textures, sounds and models remain unchanged from the original, however, the game benefits from the latest features in the Source engine including some shader effects (such as realistic water), dynamic lighting and shadow effects.

Half-Life: Source — перенесенная на движок Source версия Half-Life. Текстуры и модели остались прежними, для этого фанатами игр серии Half-Life была создана модификация High-Definition Source (ссылка ниже). Отличий от оригинала немного, например все живые тела в игре теперь ведут себя на основе системы RagDoll (с англ. - «тряпичная кукла»), но не все возможности физического движка были использованы, по вполне основательным причинам. Например, на одном из первых уровней игроку приходится прыгать по ящикам, висящим на тросах. Представьте, что будет, если эти ящики будут поддаваться реалистичным законам физики. И таких примеров масса. Дело в том, что Half-Life создавался на движке GoldSrc, поэтому портируя игру на Source, использующий новые технологии разработчикам пришлось отказаться от некоторых фишек.

group.groupName: Bear Grylls, The 8th Wonder Of the World
group.headline: Bear Grylls is the 8th Wonder of the World.
group.summary:
Edward Michael "Bear" Grylls (born 7 June 1974), a former member of the Special Air Service (SAS), made his name in 1998 by becoming, at the age of 23, the youngest Briton to climb Mount Everest and return alive.

He served for 3 years,on a part-time basis, in 21 SAS, one of two Territorial Army regiments in the Special Air Service referred to as the "SAS(R)". 21 SAS specializes in Close Target Reconnaissance and attack(CTR). During his time with 21 SAS Grylls served actively in North Africa twice. His military career ended abruptly, however, in 1996, when a routine parachute exercise in southern Africa went wrong[citation needed]. His canopy ripped severely and caused him to spiral towards earth from 16,000ft at twice the normal speed, leaving him with three broken vertebrae and left him struggling to feel his legs.[1] Grylls spent the next 12 months in rehabilitation and, with his military career over, directed his efforts into trying to get well enough to fulfill his childhood dream of climbing Everest.
No information given.
Where the chicks have dicks!

group.headline: Christian Gaming Community
group.summary:
Welcome to Christian Gaming Community!!!

Powered by the Spirit of God to manifest in those that play competitive gaming to be true and honest about ones faith in God. That we as a Body of Christ can play in a way that brings God the glory. To be outspoken about our love for Christ and to be examples in-game, as well as in our everyday day walk, that we are living for the God who saves us by His grace and mercy.

Some might say that gaming as a Christian is difficult because we are wasting our time doing something that takes no skill or puts forth no effort. I would have to disagree. Multiplayer gaming or whatever type of gaming it may be, takes a certain level of concentration to become better and to play at a level that is above reproach. We as a body of gamers can come together to make a difference even in the server that we play on to bring those around us to a saving knowledge of Jesus Christ. Maybe it might be the simple act of being courteous to others and sticking up for what you believe in that will plant a seed in someone’s mind to say that this guy/gal is different. That's all it takes for someone to want to know why you are different than everyone else. Let's play to shine God's light. Praise the Lord!!!

This group is set up for anyone to join. We ask however, that when you do join, that you understand that this group does have a main purpose in mind which is to be examples of our personal Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ. That we have intention of being set apart from the rest of this world through our faith in God and how we represent ourselves to others on the battlefield. If you would like to know more about how to become a Christian, feel free to leave a message with one of the administrators and we will contact you as soon as possible. You can also email us at email.cgc@gmail.com.




1 Corinthians 9:24-27
“Do you not know that in a race all the runners run, but only one gets the prize? Run in such a way as to get the prize. Everyone who competes in the games goes into strict training. They do it to get a crown that will not last; but we do it to get a crown that will last forever. Therefore I do not run like a man running aimlessly; I do not fight like a man beating the air. No, I beat my body and make it my slave so that after I have preached to others, I myself will not be disqualified for the prize.”

Jeremiah 33:3
“Call to me and I will answer you and tell you great and unsearchable things you do not know.”

Rules (there aren't many):

1. Don't deliberately come in here trolling and picking fights. There are plenty of other groups that revolve around that. You don't have to suck up to anyone or agree with everything people say, but don't be an ass.
2. No. Walls. Of. Spam.

It has been a long and awesome journey, But the random chatroom is going on retirement, where it will eventually be deleted after a short period of time.

The group is being deleted for a number of reasons. I no longer have time to run the group, And giving it to anyone would only result in future e-drama. (So please do NOT ask.) In my absence, Most of the active members have already left, So the group is technically dead anyway. And this group has also been the source of a lot of e-drama, something i never intended this group to become. Sadly, The "Golden days" have long since gone.

But with all that said, I wanted to thank all of the frequent visitors of this chatroom deeply, And to everyone who helped administrate the group, past and present. You've helped turn what was once a tiny one-man steamgroup into an amazing chatroom filled with people and cultures of all types.

And though this group is going, Many other awesome steamgroups have been created that are far better then this group, to be honest.

Thanks again everyone, For making this group a truly Random experience. :D

group.headline: Half-Life: 2
group.summary:
Half-Life 2 is one of the best selling games of all time, and the entire Half Life series is the best selling games to date.

In Half-Life 2, you battle the Combine, Headcrabs, and Zombies to help take back the Earth from the Combine's control.

In this game, as with the last, you play Gordon Freeman, a scientist from Black Mesa who caused the Black Mesa incident, teams up with the Rebels and the Vortiugaunts to fight the Combine and re-take the Earth.

Alyx Vance is Eli Vance's daughter who teams up with you in the entire Half Life 2 series to help stop the Combine and take the Earth back from their brute control.

Half-Life Games as of today:

Half-Life, Half-Life: Source, Half-Life: Blueshift, Half-Life: Opposing Force, Half-Life 2, Half-Life 2: Episode 1, Half-Life 2: Episode 2, Half-Life 2: Lost Coast, Half-Life 2: Deathmatch

Counter-Strike (também abreviado por CS) é um popular jogo de computador, mais especificamente um "mod" de Half-Life para jogos online. É um jogo de tiro em primeira pessoa baseado em rodadas no qual equipas de contra-terroristas e terroristas combatem-se até a vitória. Requer muita estratégia, trabalho de equipa, e habilidade para ser um vencedor. É acessível através do Steam. O jogo inicialmente era para ser um mod para o Unreal Tournament, mas a Valve viu uma oportunidade no jogo e compro-o. Em 2005/2006 saiu Counter Strike Source, source porque utiliza o motor gráfico Source, dando uma nova física e melhores gráficos ao jogo.

O Counter-Strike foi um dos responsáveis pela massificação dos jogos por rede no início do século, sendo considerado o grande responsável pela popularização das LAN houses no mundo. O jogo é considerado um "desporto electrónico". Muitas pessoas levam-no a sério e recebem ordenados fixos, existem mesmo clans profissionais, e que são patrocinados por grandes empresas como a Intel e a NVIDIA.

Pelo mundo existem ligas profissionais onde o Counter-Strike está presente, como o caso da CPL, ESWC, ESL, WCG e WEG. No caso da ESWC funciona da seguinte forma: cada país tem as suas qualificações no qual qualquer clan pode ir a uma qualificação em uma lan house em qualquer parte do mesmo país, passando depois às melhores equipes, as melhores equipes de cada país encontram-se depois no complexo da ESWC, localizado em Paris, para disputar o lugar da melhor equipe do mundo de Counter-Strike.

Com a chegada da sequência de Half-Life, Half-Life 2, o Counter-Strike ganhou uma versão com gráficos mais actualizados chamada de Counter-Strike: Source, também acessível pelo Steam. Apesar de contar com gráficos mais bem elaborados e correção de erros, essa versão não é oficialmente utilizada nas maiores ligas competitivas principalmente devido a menor divulgação dessa versão e de inúmeras inovações consideradas negativas com relação ao ritmo de jogo, que nessa nova versão é sensivelmente mais lento do que nas antecedentes.

group.headline: Counter-Strike 1.6
group.summary:
There are 3 games in the Counter-Strike series. There is Counter-Strike Source. Then you have the middle aged brother out of the group, Counter-Strike Condition Zero. Sure these two updated and improved versions are some what good. But the oldest brother is the best. Counter-Strike 1.6. Thought it is the oldest out of all the three, it seems to me that it's the most played and respected game out of them all. I mean sure the other two may be fun. But there is no match up to what the real game. What I mean by this, Counter-Strike 1.6 is the orignal and by far best Counter-Strike ever made. So basically this game may be old but it is the most played and fun out of the three.

Reason being, Counter-Strike 1.6 has the most active and filled Steam Community. The legit and good players of the Counter-Strike series have stayed with the old school. Even though 1.6 may not have as good as graphics as Condition Zero or Counter-Strike Source. It is the most played and talked about around the gaming world. You dont see big gaming websites talking about Condition Zero events. There are no big major Condition Zero events. All of the good and legit players are basically all playing Counter-Strike 1.6. Sure there is some talk about Counter-Strike Source. But non the less, Counter-Strike 1.6 takes some skill to play and become well known as a top notch player. As in Counter-Strike Source there are many messed up things with aim and registration. So really even the slitest baddies can get somewhere with Counter-Strike Source. For as in Counter-Strike 1.6 there is a good amount of skillz needed to play the gama. Atleast to play good.

Soon I hear that a new Counter-Strike is coming into play. Sort of a combination of all three games. Condition-Zero, Counter-Strike Source put some play into it. But see they do not use anything from Counter-Strike 1.6. Theres another good reason why this game is going to be just like Condition-Zero and Counter-Strike Source. Sure people may play the game for a while when its comes out. But all in all Counter-Strike 1.6 is going to be the best Counter-Strike game in the series. Like stated earlier graphics dont matter to me. As well as they dont matter to real gamers. If you play a game cause of it's graphics, then im really sorry to tell you that you are not a real gamer. Its said but true. Games are never about the graphics. Its what the game is and if people enjoy playing it. Sure graphics are sometimes nice. But Counter-Strike 1.6 does not have the greatest graphics in the world and it is one of the most well known and played games in the whole gaming world.
________________________________________

-pk1

group.headline: I'm Commander Shepard and this is my favorite station on the internet.
group.summary:
The official group for the not so recently created Stereotoads, a radio station for the community. Join our chat if you want to make requests and kick back. I want to thank Traffic Cone for the idea of making a group, Sergeant "Mud" Krinkle for the name and Pencil for our original avatar. Our awesome current avatar is courtesy of Zombie Thorfinn/I don't know. If you want to join us, ask for an invite from a member or in chat: it's open for guests.

http://stereotoads.org:8000/stream.m3u

We're always looking for new DJs - don't be afraid to talkfag. If you want to give it a try, just let me know. Don't forget to put your name in description field and to fill in the genre field if you intend to play just one particular kind of music. Furthermore, try to have a playlist ready with at least one hour of music before asking to DJ. And last, but not least, try to find a replacement before you stop broadcasting. Refer to this thread for a simple DJ guide. A more thorough one will be written soon (valve time). Also, don't leave the DSP Plugin on auto-reconnect.

http://www.stereotoads.org/chan/fm/res/4.html

In order to listen to Stereotoads, you can use Winamp, VLC Player or foobar2000. You might get an error when there's a DJ change. In that case, just reconnect by hitting your play button again. If you don't want to do that every DJ change, simply put it on repeat, it should reconnect automatically.

Thanks to Kalkin and him hosting FA nowadays, we've got our own gosh dang board!

http://boards.fightingamphibians.org/fm/

We now have our own imageboard, along with our website (still under construction). Hooray for us.

http://stereotoads.org/chan/

And now we also have a Lastfm group, made by WAKI. One step closer to world domination.

http://www.lastfm.com/group/Stereotoads

group.summary:
░░░▒▒▒▒▓▓▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒
╔╦╦╦═╦╗╔═╦═╦══╦═╗

________________________________________

Michael Myers (Halloween)


Michael Myers is a fictional character from the Halloween series of slasher films. He first appears in John Carpenter's Halloween (1978) as a young boy who murders his older sister, then fifteen years later returns home to murder more teenagers. In the original Halloween, the adult Michael Myers, referred to as The Shape in the closing credits, was portrayed by Nick Castle for most of the film, with Tony Moran and Tommy Lee Wallace substituting in during the final scenes. He was created by Debra Hill and John Carpenter. Michael Myers has appeared in eight films, as well as novels, a video game and several comic books.

The character is the primary antagonist in the Halloween film series, except Halloween III: Season of the Witch, which was not connected in continuity to the rest of the films. Since Castle, Moran, and Wallace put on the mask in the original film, six people have stepped into the role. There have been no actors to portray the character in consecutive films, with a new actor filling the role in each succeeding film; only one actor has portrayed the character more than once. Michael Myers is characterized as pure evil, whether directly in the films, by the filmmakers who created and developed the character over eight films, or random participants in a survey.


Read more in: www.wikipea.com

group.headline: iOGaming.NET - #1 International Gaming Community
group.summary:
[ iOGaming.NET ]
www.iOGaming.NET

Welcome to the iOGaming STEAM Community Group! We are an international multi-gaming community (not a clan) with a wide player base all across the world! We currently officially support Team Fortress 2, Left4Dead Series, Battlefield Bad Company 2, Battlefield 2, Heroes of Newerth, and expanding! All of our members share a common belief of playing together and playing to win! We're the only community to give away free stuff just for playing on our servers, so check out all of our servers and our website! Additionally, we hold tournaments very often so be sure to check back and play in any of one of our FIFTEEN servers throughout the variety of games we offer: TF2, Left4Dead and Battlefield2.

At iOGaming, we do not sell admin or even VIP reserved slots like most other communities do. We firmly believe that you should not have to pay to hold a spot in our servers and that admin's should only be people who genuinely care about the direction of the community and upholding the fairness & quality the absolute ideal community should offer. However we also believe that if you are donating money to help a community run, you should receive not only recognition, but some sort of physical benefits as well. The staff at iOGaming really took the time to think and develop actual in-game benefits that would not effect game play while adding to the fun of the game. We did just that and are now able to offer you (instantly) upon donation, fun benefits to reward you for helping make iO what it is today. Check out the benefits at: http://iOGaming.net/donate

** Apply for the [iO] tag @ http://iogaming.net/signup - We are always looking for some cool new members!

Stop in and join us on any of our 8 TF2 servers below.

group.headline: osu! rhythm is just a click away
group.summary:
What is osu!?
osu! is a rhythm game based on the gameplay of a variety of popular commercial rhythm games. While aiming to keep authentic gameplay and scoring, osu! increases the epic factor through online rankings, multiplayer, replay exchange, and a huge community following.
Also available is a fully functional built-in editor, allowing intuitive creation of your own beatmaps for the songs you want to play.
Whether you end up being a hardcore player, or a well-respected beatmap creator (or some place in-between :), there is something for everybody within the osu! community.

group.headline: The Gamers Playground
group.summary:
The GamersPlayground.com

The Gamersplayground is a community of gamers who enjoy a very social gaming environment. We are NOT a clan.
We invite and encourage friendly and social oriented gaming for everyone.

We originally began forming shortly after the release of TeamFortress 2.

The Gamersplayground has run gaming servers on 46 different IP's for TF2, TFC, CSS, DOD, INS, L4D, L4D2, Battlefield Bad Company 2, AlienSwarm, QuakeWars, KillingFloor, Unreal Tournament 3 and HalfLife Deathmatch.

Our community has grown and spread to other games as well. Borderlands, Civilization, Fallout, Dawn of Discovery, Worms, Torchlight, Garry'sMod, DefenseGrid, DeadSpace, Mass Effect, Dragon Age and many more.

We play both PC and Console Games and review and test both games and the technology on our forums.

You can find and join us at www.thegamersplayground.com

FaceBook : Thegamersplayground
YouTube Channel: http://www.youtube.com/user/TheGamersPlayground

group.headline: Consume the Fruits of Victory!
group.summary:
Feast upon the glory of [FOOD]!

When battling with [FOOD], you battle for the sake of your appetite!

Have you ever felt the warmth of a steaming bowl of chili grin between your drooling lips or the smell of fresh sizzling moist bacon on the frying pan, smothered with freshness and pure goodness? What about Momma's sweet apple pie, luring you to the first precious slice of delight!


We understand your needs, we feel your ever-growing hunger and need! We are [FOOD], we defend our brethern who sit across us from the dinner table. The ones who sigh with relief and satisfaction when dominating each other's dinner plates.

Raise your arms in our name! Shed fresh pesto and tomato sauce in our presence! We're starved for victory!

- [FOOD], Fighting Outrageously Over Dinner, The Clan is open for all!

Nuka-Cola was invented in 2044 by John Caleb-Bradberton. Due to its unique taste, it quickly became the world's most popular soft drink with a dedicated following. The color of the bottles was changed to Dazzling Blue (scientifically proven to be the most pleasing of all blues) after market research done in 2052 said that the blue color was the favorite in 86 people out of a hundred polled. By 2067, vending machines with ice-cold Nuka-Cola could be found on virtually every street in America.
The drink's ingredients are Carbonated Water, Caramel Color, Aspartame, Phosphoric Acid, Potassium Benzoate (To Protect Taste), Natural Flavors, Citric Acid and Caffeine. The flavor of Nuka-Cola is the essence of seventeen different fruits mixed in just the right proportion to give the beverage its trademark taste. In the Great Passion Fruit Famine of 2044, people actually noticed the taste difference when the flavor was changed. The drink also includes vitaminerals and health tonics.

Aside from the original version, the company also created Cherry Nuka-Cola, but unfortunately nobody liked the taste. After the marketing disaster that was Cherry, Nuka-Cola attempted to save the brand by introducing the Classic Nuka-Cola. It tasted exactly the same as the original but came in a new bottle.

In 2077, a new version called Nuka-Cola Quantum was introduced. According to the advertisements, it had twice the calories, twice the carbohydrates, twice the caffeine and twice the taste. To make it stand out more on the shelves and to give it an extra kick, the Quantum included a mild radioactive strontium isotope (and an eighteenth fruit flavor - pomegranate). The effect was a drink that not only boosted your energy, but also glowed with a bright blue light. While no ill effects were recorded by the Food and Drug Association, the isotope also caused the drinker's urine to glow.

The company's main factory was located in Washington, DC, which used cutting edge equipment to keep the world's most popular soft drink in full production 24 hours a day.

"We need 4 hugs a day for survival. We need 8 hugs a day for maintenance. We need 12 hugs a day for growth..." Virginia Satir

Sometimes, a hug is all what we need.

"How it all started:

I'd been living in London when my world turned upside down and I'd had to come home. By the time my plane landed back in Sydney, all I had left was a carry on bag full of clothes and a world of troubles. No one to welcome me back, no place to call home. I was a tourist in my hometown.

Standing there in the arrivals terminal, watching other passengers meeting their waiting friends and family, with open arms and smiling faces, hugging and laughing together, I wanted someone out there to be waiting for me. To be happy to see me. To smile at me. To hug me.

So I got some cardboard and a marker and made a sign. I found the busiest pedestrian intersection in the city and held that sign aloft, with the words "Free Hugs" on both sides.

And for 15 minutes, people just stared right through me. The first person who stopped, tapped me on the shoulder and told me how her dog had just died that morning. How that morning had been the one year anniversary of her only daughter dying in a car accident. How what she needed now, when she felt most alone in the world, was a hug. I got down on one knee, we put our arms around each other and when we parted, she was smiling.

Everyone has problems and for sure mine haven't compared. But to see someone who was once frowning, smile even for a moment, is worth it every time.

Why Did it get banned?

Public liability fear and red tape. But its all okay now! Make sure tocheck your local laws before embarking on your Hugathon!

Special Thanks

I would just like to thank Sick Puppies for their incredible song "All the Same " which the free hugs campaign video would have never been the same without."

- http://www.freehugscampaign.org/



If you're wanting to join just message someone who can invite :)

i cannot stress this more! DO NOT ACCEPT FRIEND OR CHAT INVITES FROM PEOPLE YOU DO NOT KNOW!!!!!Heres is a victim:
Player/ Yay man: This is a public serves announcement if you get invited to a chat or a friend invite from this person please do not except he will hack you if you sent what to get hacked don't reply yes instead ignore the invite!! here's the nickname "^Pb | Mystery" here is his page: http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561197993955920

plus: shaunno94 isa trying to fish for account passwords and user names. He will send a message and pretend to be concerned about something and link you to a page that will look identicle to a Steam page. The URL at the top is a fake and not used by Valve or steam, so if you enter your user name and password your account will be hijacked.

This Time:

okay, i've seen a lot of dumbass stuff that's happened on tf2, but this one just may be the dumbest! we were playing goldrush on the defending team and we were doing amasing! the blu team didn't even capture the first point and we had a minute till time ran out! Some retarded medic on our team decided to uber an enemy spy disguised as a pyro and helped him sap all the sentrys and buildings we had built! damn griefer!

Last Time:

Yesterday, i experienced the lamest and most epic TF2 arena lumberyard match. The game went on & on. Eventually, there were 4 players left on red, and 1 player left on blu. To make matters even more lame was that the blu player was afk! The task is easy,kill a non-moving target right? What was the problem? There was a blu sentry. 1 by 1, the red team was being slauterd by a single sentry gun. It was even fully upgraded!!! I can understand that it was a bit more complicated without a spy. But they had a damn medic!! Anyhow, red lost. Sentry FTW!!!



Go to this website if you want to post something.
All the previous stories are there and archived
And let me know if you want me to change our website in the comments. The other is a series on youtube of funny things that happened on L4D. Go watch it! d:D

Please note, an invitation to our Steam group does NOT mean you are a clan member. Only Xtreme Assault Clan Members can wear our clan tags. Doing so without permission may lead to a ban! If you are interested in applying, please visit our website @ www.xa-battleclan.com for more details.

group.headline: Machinima Creators United
group.summary:
What is The Machinima Foundation?

The Machinima Foundation in partnership with Novus Ventus Films is a society in which Machinima creators from all around the globe can discuss, share, and interact with each other.


Why?

Machinima is the result of modern day advancments in technology and film. The Machinima Genre is growing rapidly and outputing extrodinary films every day.

Who Can Join?

Anyone can join the Machinima Foundation. It is meant to be place to share ideas, and tips. A place where upcoming Machinimists can learn the tricks of the trade and where supporters of the art can express their feeling.
We just want to make friends and have team fun. Nothing more or less.

group.headline: Sharpen your hunter teeth!
group.summary:
Version 1.0 of HUNTER GAMES mod is now available for download at www.huntergames.org!


HUNTER GAMES Intro video is up!

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2q7CKpAoX4Y&fmt=22

Be sure to watch in HD!

"Hunter Games" is a Left 4 Dead mod that forces all 8 players in a server to the infected team, and only allows hunters. Various games are played and enforced by the server.

Tag (claw to tag another player if you are "it")

Reverse Tag/Keepaway (claw to "steal" from another player and make yourself "it")

Infection/Last Man Standing (claw to infect another player if you are "infected")

Pounce Race (npc survivor bots are teleported to random map locations, and hunters must race to pounce them)

25 Damage Pounce Session (npc survivor bots run through the map, and all hunters must attempt 25 damage pounces on them)

The individual mini games listed above are short, from 2 to 5 minutes a piece. When one mini game finishes, the next one begins!

Sharpen up your hunter skills!

We currently have 3 servers we try to run 24/7. Be patient, there are still a few bugs, but they should generally be very playable!

group.headline: BONK!
group.summary:
INFORMATION
----------------------

Bonk! Atomic Punch is an unlockable replacement for the Scout's Pistol. It does not increase the scout's speed but rather, it provides temporary invincibility. During this period, the scout cannot attack, pick up the intelligence, or cap points. In addition, his view is forced into third-person mode. When any of type of bullet or projectile hits a running Scout during the drink's effects, a "Miss!" effect will appear above his head . Sentry guns will not damage a Scout under the influence of Bonk!, but he will still experience knockback. The scout has unlimited Bonk! cans, but cannot take out another can until his cooldown period is over. Note that you cannot use Bonk while carrying the intel.

The scout runs just as fast in all directions while under the effects of Bonk! as he does otherwise. During the cooldown time while the drink's effects wear off, he can again attack enemies but moves at 75% of the baseline speed, slightly faster than a Soldier. By comparison, this is ~56% of his normal speed. The scout can move slightly faster by running diagonally as opposed to running straight ahead.

RED's flavor of Bonk! is "Cherry Fission", while the BLU version is "Blutonium Berry".



DAMAGE
--------------



None. Provides short-term invulnerability.


FUNCTION TIMES
--------------------------


Approximately 1.25 seconds to drink. Enemies attacking you during this phase can damage you, and may disrupt the animation. 6 seconds of boost time, with another 6 seconds of cooldown time.

group.headline: Entra in тнє_вєѕт_gяσυρ_ιтαℓιαи!!!
group.summary:
Sei anche tu un' italiano alla ricerca di qualche gruppo bello e famoso?
Benissimo, allora entra anche tu a far parte del gruppo TBGI. Qui, potrai divertirti, trovare amicizie, giocare insieme a noi e molte altre cose divertenti!
Questo gruppo è un fun e per chi non sapesse cosa sia un fun è una specie di gruppo internazionale in grado di riunire tutti i giocatori del mondo ma in un gruppo italiano. Questo magnifico gruppo è stato basato su due principali giochi: Day of Defeat: Source; Half-Life2: DeathMatch. Per questi 2 giochi non cè un server :( e se ci fosse qualcuno gentilissimo da comprare un server, sarà rispettato e avrà quasi tutte le funzioni di un gruppo steam. Bene, credo di aver spiegato tutto il neccessario per voi e quindi vi auguro un buon divertimento!
Ritornando a me, io mi chiamo Eros ho 13 anni e sono di aosta. Beh, sono il ragazzo nella foto (sono molto figo xD) e come ben tutti voi avrete notato ci sono state delle "rivoluzioni" tra me e Falco. TBGI, ha fatto davvero un bel numero di membri e io non me la sarei aspettato quindi un GRAZIE! a tutti quelli che stanno dentro senza problemi. All' inzio, quando ho creato il gruppo pensavo di coinvolgere una 90 di membri non un' numero eccessivo ai 90 e da quando ho incominciato a invitare membri non ho piu smesso perchè sinceramente e francamente non mi stanco perchè per me è un hobby. Ragazzi, vi chiedo di invitare gente perchè se tutti invitiamo potremo essere il primo gruppo italiano piu famoso di steam! Pensateci su tutti quanti voi del gruppo. Comunque da solo a gestire un gruppo non è tanto facile perciò io gradirei volentieri un aiutante per organizzare eventi di chat oppure tornei di giochi... Sarebbe bello ;)

group.headline: For all those against YouTube.
group.summary:
*Warning: the following contains offensive language not suitable to some people who are old enough to browse YouTube (3-4 months old - 115 years).

I swear to god these retards browsing the YouTube site are so dumb. They post comments about the most random and utterly stupid stereotypical nonsense when, guarantee it, 2/3 of them haven't even finished watching the video. As if we fucking cared about their goddamned opinion and their fucking retarded horseshit.

And the chain comments. Don't get me fucking started about those. "Any 'Tuberz' who read this will probably get assassinated within the next 3 days unless you solemnly swear never to visit that site again." You know what im talking about, heres a parody of it. Fucking paranoid kid thinking clowns with chainsaws will fucking rape and murder their little sisters. These people are so fucking retarded. They either love a video to fucking death or hate it with their balls wrapped around their fucking heads, ready to suicide bomb any reasonable person who decides to post a reasonable comment on any "reasonable video."

And what the fuck is with the fucking cocksucking bastards begging people to watch their videos. Who the fuck cares who sees a video and who doesnt. You are fucking retarded thinking that the amount of viewers your videos have means something. And it doesnt end there. Those fucking lazy fat-ass 10 year old monkey-fuckers begging other cock-suckers and other anally raped douchebags (sorry ladies) who beg people to "rate my video" or "comment" or "subscribe." Those retards can "rate how fast my foot shoves up their asses" or "subscribe and comment on how fast I'd beat those retards to death with a pink dildo (cause pink is a good colour, do you have a problem with that?).

Steve Chen, Chad Hurley, and Jawed Kim. You three created the most infectious and incontainable virus ever to plague the earth. Be proud, we will never forget how you cockblocked physical activity and raped laziness in the ass. Look what it gave birth to.

Join us and stand against YouTube and all the piece of shit things that website stands for.

Armed with an alien nursery-worth of zombie-zapping plants like peashooters and cherry bombs, you'll need to think fast and plant faster to stop dozens of types of zombies dead in their tracks. Thank you everyone for ur support. It means so much more than U guys and gals will ever know.

We Love u Guys and Gals - From the start we wanted to make a place where players were respected and knew they were wanted. A place where people could come and forget thier real life problems and have fun with friends and future friends that they meet here. A place where the admins understand that the players should be respected and honored and be treated as such. A place that knows the real value of gaming and that is you, the gaming community, We wanted a place where everybody felt welcome and could be themselves without any racial or real life griefing. A place where everybody knew your name and would take the time to say hi.

U all are the best bunch of people ever.

We started with one Convoy server.........

Hoping just to get all the old dedicated Convoy 1 players back together. Giving everyone that loves CONVOY 1, a place to hang out, have fun and kill some time while attracting even more players to one of the best TF2 maps ever.

Thanks for all ur support - We do love u all

Thank you

group.headline: www.Left4Dead2PC.com
group.summary:
Left 4 Dead 2 fans need somewhere they can view, share and discuss the game in a friendly enviroment. Our goal is to focus on gathering the Left 4 Dead 2 community in one place, bringing you everything you need to get the best gaming experience. We provide our members with Left 4 Dead 2 servers, sponsored by Dustworld, moderated forums, up-to-date news, game information, our own Left 4 Dead 2 tournaments where teams compete to win big prizes and much more!

We encourage our members to use teamwork, strategies and to have fun while playing. With a friendly environment it's just so much more fun isn't it? You do not have to be a serious gamer to join this community, Its purpose is to bring Left 4 Dead 2 fans together and enhance YOUR experience.

group.headline: ARE YOU GORDON FREEMAN?
group.summary:
Struggling through years of schooling, and finally acquiring a PhD in order to do such things as pushing a cart and pressing a button.
Running through miles of hostile aliens, soldiers, death-trap puzzles to get to the other side of a wooden door.
Saving hundreds of scientists in a cheap attempt to cover up the fact that you were the one who caused all this in the first place.
Observing that, time after time, you will coincidently never, even in a heavily militarized area, find an automatic before you've already had a pistol for some time.
Getting clearance to top-secret research facilities, starting a world-wide revolution, and seducing a woman in the middle of a post-apocalypse, all without saying one word.
...such are only a fraction of your accomplishments. You have been through Black Mesa, through City 17, through White Forest, and you brought with you nothing but your silent charm, a steady mind, and a high-powered super-suit capable of sustaining multiple gunshot wounds to the unprotected face. You have done it all. YOU ARE GORDON FREEMAN.

group.headline: /̵͇̿/'̿-̅-̅-̅' Left 4 Dead 2 ︻デ═一
group.summary:
Left 4 Dead 2 is a cooperative first-person shooter game. It is the sequel to the award winning Left 4 Dead. The games current release date is set for November 17, 2009, for Microsoft Window and the Xbox 360. Like the origonal, Left 4 Dead 2 takes place during the aftermath of an apocalyptic pandemic, and focuses on four survivors fighting against hordes of the infected. Several new features will be introduced, such as new types of infected, melee weapons, and a story-arc that connects each of the game's five campaigns together into one full game.


Campaigns:

The Parish, Swamp Fever, Hard Rain, Dark Carnival, The Passing, Dead Center


Weapons:

Firearms:

50 CAL, Auto Shotgun, Auto Shotgun SPAS, AWP, FX, Grenade Launcher, Hunting Rifle, Minigun, MP5 Navy, Rifle, Rifle AK-47, Rifle Desert, Scout, SG-552, Shotgun, Shotgun Chrome, SMG, SMG Silenced, Sniper Military


Secondary Firearms:

Dual Pistol, Magnum, Pistol, Pistol Silver


Melee Weapons:

Axe, Bat , Chainsaw, Guitar, Katana, Knife, Machete, Pan, Tonfa


Supplies:

Main Supplies:

Health kit, Defibrillator, Ammo pack


Secondary Supplies:

Pills, Adrenaline


Explosives:

Molotov, Pipe bomb, CEDA Jar


Ammo upgrades:

Incendiary Ammo, Explosive Ammo, Laser Light


Special Infected:

Charger, Spitter, Jockey, Boomer, Hunter, Smoker, Tank, Witch


Common Infected:

Hazmat, Mudmen, Riot Cops, Clowns, Constuction Worker


Left 4 Dead 2 features a new cast of human survivors, which will include Coach, a high-school football coach with a bad knee; Rochelle, a news reporter for a local television station; Ellis, a mechanic; and Nick, a gambler and conman. While the game was intended to be a continuation of the original, occurring a week after the first game begins, it was decided to create a new group of survivors because of the change in location. In addition to the four playable characters, Left 4 Dead 2 also features a support character in the form of Virgil, a Cajun boat captain, who appears in the game's later three chapters. This differs from the original game, where NPCs made little more than a single appearance.

L4D2 Enthusiasts [Yes-L4D2] was created so Enthusiasts looking forward to Left 4 Dead 2 could talk and get daily news updates about the game that they are looking forward to. We plan on explanding our group, by creating Left 4 Dead 2 servers, later upon the release of the game.

group.groupName: We Are Ready for the Orange Box 2
group.summary:
This group wants to send a message to valve that it is time to make another box!! Red box, green box, black box, even pink box it doesn't matter, as long it has another 4-5 good games in it we're happy puppies :)!!


The purpose is to have 15.000 members.. To show that we would most welcome another Orange Box! Spread the world!!


!Read below for more information!

THE BOX

We would like to see for example this kind of box contents:

(in development) COUNTER-STRIKE 2
(in development) HALF-LIFE: EPISODE 3
(announced) PORTAL 2
(in development) A SUPRISE GAME -> note: has IceFrog something to do with it?


for a pleasurable price of course..(like the first orange box) + it would be nice if it shipped on the 12TH BIRTHDAY OF HALF-LIFE (2010, november, 19)!!

HISTORY

Since my post on the steam forums (http://forums.steampowered.com/forums/showthread.php?t=887659), people send me a lot of messages how cool it would be if another Orange Box was coming.. So it brought me to the idea to create a group for those who want to see The Orange Box 2 see the light!!

PROOF THAT ORANGE BOX 2 IS COMING

Source: http://www.videogamesblogger.com/2008/03/03/counter-strike-2-in-the-orange-box-2-what-to-expect-in-half-life-2-episode-3.htm

"Whether Counter-Strike 2 becomes part of The Oranger Box 2 or not, you can bet on two other games to be part of it: Portal 2 and HL2: Episode 3.."

-> since Gabe Newell confirmed that IF an Orange Box 2 comes it will contain Counter-Strike 2 that would make already three games for the BOX!!

group.headline: I give you hat, you give me hat.
group.summary:
A Brief History of Hats
"Throughout history, men have worn hats as a way of showing how much better they are than other men. “I buy hats,” a behatted man seems to say. “I am better than you.”
In wartime, hats were a useful way of conferring rank, and ensuring that casualties were confined to the lower classes (hence the famous command of “Don't fire till you see the tops of their heads” at the Battle of Bunker Hill by William Prescott, a general renowned for only shooting enemy combatants who were poor). During peacetime, hats have been instrumental for men to let the non-hatted know just who is wearing the hat around here."

Hats (or Headwear) are items of equipment with their own 'head' section in the loadout screen. Hats have no direct effect on gameplay and are for cosmetic purposes only. They are unlocked at random during in-game playtime. Every 15,430 seconds (4 hours, 17 minutes, and 10 seconds) you have a 3.5714% chance of receiving a hat. Codewise, every 4 hours, 17 minutes and 10 seconds, the game rolls a virtual 84 sided die. If the number on that virtual die is a 1, 2 or 3, you will receive a hat.

*TRADING MISC. ITEMS TOO!*

*JOIN THE TF2 SI CLUB!*

*TRADE HALLOWEEN HATS TOO!*

*BILL'S HAT? GO AHEAD*

Come down to the Hat Exchange Floor (HEF) to trade hats/misc. items safely and securely. Here's how it works, your friends/us invite you to trade. (Hats or misc.), Then you can set up your trade!

Format:
(Name your hat/item)
(Hat/item you want)

Easy! Post your offer in the Announcements or Comments section.

group.headline: |241| JailBreaK |241|
group.summary:
Two for One (241) Jailbreak Clan

Forum .com(dot com): http://241jailbreak.omgforum.net/forum.htm

General Rules:** **** * ( A list of rules, compliments of your beloved hosts[241 Style])

NO ADVERTISING, NO DISRESPECTING THE ADMINSTRATORS/MEMBERS/ OR PLAYERS (on server, vent, or Steam chat), NO MIC-SPAMMING, NO BLOCKING, NO SWITCHING TEAMS AFTER AN ADMIN HAS RECENTLY SWITCHED YOU (i.e. failed mic-check on behalf of CT), Ts MAY NOT SPEAK BEFORE 8:50, THE LAST CT MAY DO WHATEVER THEY WISH.

Note: These rules are to encourage and promote order and fun FOR ALL PLAYERS.

CT Rules:


1. CTs can't(cannot) free-kill. If you free-kill: slay yourself, or an admin will do it for you. Excessive free-kills will earn you a special achievement/trophy/award reserved for lamers: ban.

2. CTs may only kill Ts if they are failing objective, or are rebelling.

3. CTs must have a mic and must be able to speak English well; CTs must also have knowledge of the rules and the game, as a whole.

4. There is only one(1) lead CT at a time, lead may be passed via voice and you must state the (CT)player's name of whom is receiving lead.

5. CTs must have the cells opened by 8:00, CTs also must have given orders before opening cells.

6. CTs must have given orders by the time the cells have been opened, if not it's a freeday.

7. CTs may not aid the Ts in any way, example: gun-planting, blocking other CT's for the assistance(or gain) of Ts.

8. CTs may only kill rebelling Ts if they see them rebel.

9. CTs may not camp if not the last CT; if you are the last CT you may do whatever you wish.


T's Rules:


1. Ts may not use voice chat before 8:50. If you commit this infraction; you will be given the choice to suicide, or an admin will do it for you.

WARNING! IF YOU GET SLAYED FOR TALKING BEFORE 8:50; AND YOU COMPLAIN YOU WILL BE KICK AND OR BANNED.

2. LR Rules: If you are the last T, you may lr (!lr). If you win a last request game, then you may kill the CT whom lost. If the CT slays himself, and does not let you kill them; they will be slayed next round, or banned.

CTs do NOT have to accept custom lrs from the last T.

group.headline: What.
group.summary:
NOTICE:I've contacted Steam Support and have set things straight, seems someone got the wrong idea about this group and told support.

We are the 4secutors, a group of concerned individuals dedicated to disproving the lies about the furry community and showing the public how destructive it is.



Our goal is not to harass furries but to show parents and those who do not have our inside knowledge of the furry community how sick it is and how its leaders prey on young children over Steam. We have informed Steam Support of this in the past, and they admit it is true, thus this group was unlocked.

Members of the furry community call us "Fursecuters" in an attempt to discredit us and imply we're trolls, we are not, but if that's the title we must take to protect children on the internet from sexual predators then so be it, we are the 4secutors.



NOTE: If you have any questions about this group or any comments on its activities please comment on my profile and I will get back to you to clear up any misunderstandings.

Posts with swear words in them won't be deleted (unless that's against the rules, I don't know if it is), but calls to harass people will.

group.headline: A group for people who like that moe shit.
group.summary:
Moe (萌え?, /mo.e/, pronounced "mo-eh" literally "budding", as with a plant) is a Japanese slang word originally referring to a strong interest in particular types of character in video games or anime and manga. For example, 眼鏡っ娘萌え, meganekko-moe, "glasses-girl moe", describes a person who is attracted to fictional characters with eyeglasses. "Moe!" is also used within anime fandom as an interjection referring to a character the speaker considers to be a moekko. It is even used in some anime, such as Ouran High School Host Club, Ai Kora, Lucky Star, Kaichou-wa Maid-sama!, The Melancholy Of Haruhi Suzumiya and K-ON. There are various interpretations of what moe is today. Joseph L. Dela Pena argues that moe is a pure, protective feeling towards a character,
Both the spellings moe and moé are used in English. Some writers add an accent mark in an attempt to indicate that the word should be pronounced as two morae, "mo" and "e", but this usage does not conform to any standard of romanization.

group.headline: Not even the universe itself has the gift if non-existence.
group.summary:
Now, this is a story all about how
My life got flipped-turned upside down
And I liked to take a minute
Just sit right there
I'll tell you how I became the prince of a town called Bel Air

In west Philadelphia born and raised
On the playground was where I spent most of my days
Chillin' out maxin' relaxin' all cool
And all shootin some b-ball outside of the school
When a couple of guys
Who were up to no good
Started making trouble in my neighborhood
I got in one little fight and my mom got scared
She said 'You're movin' with your auntie and uncle in Bel Air'

I begged and pleaded with her day after day
But she packed my suite case and send me on my way
She gave me a kiss and then she gave me my ticket.
I put my walkman on and said, 'I might as well kick it'.

First class, yo this is bad
Drinking orange juice out of a champagne glass.
Is this what the people of Bel-Air living like?
Hmmmmm this might be alright.

But wait I hear they're prissy, wine all that
Is Bel-Air the type of place they send this cool cat?
I don't think so
I'll see when I get there
I hope they're prepared for the prince of Bel-Air

Well, the plane landed and when I came out
There was a dude who looked like a cop standing there with my name out
I ain't trying to get arrested
I just got here
I sprang with the quickness like lightning, disappeared

I whistled for a cab and when it came near
The license plate said 'FRESH' and it had dice in the mirror
If anything I can say this cab is rare
But I thought 'Now forget it' - 'Yo homes to Bel Air'

I pulled up to the house about 7 or 8
And I yelled to the cabbie 'Yo homes smell ya later'
I looked at my kingdom
I was finally there
To settle my throne as the Prince of Bel Air
No information given.
No information given.
THE OFFICIAL STEAM GROUP FOR THAT LOVEABLE FOX

Le Vanilla is a TF2 community that we want to build upon the following premises: Friendship, fun, enjoyment, and good competitive nature. We want to run the -best- vanilla TF2 servers. group.headline: =(eGO)= has too large an =(Ego)=!
group.summary:
I. Introduction:
We select members of the Steam community have come together to protest the popularity of a gaming organization. This gaming organization uses underminded tactics to populate their servers, and while in their servers does not respect their regulars unless they become part of the organization. This organization we speak of is EdgeGamers, or =(eGO)=™, as they abbriviate themselves in-game.

II. Disclaimer
We do not hate every single member of =(eGO)=™, or even single members of =(eGO)=™, we simply hate the organization and how it presents itself to the gaming community. Why, some of us even have good friends in =(eGO)=™.


III. Our Quarrel
__A. Trademarking Overuse - They shove ™ down your throat.
__B. Spaces in Server Titles - They use spaces to bump themselves up the server browser.
__C. Advertisements - Ads cause you to get banned quickly because they take up space where rules should go.
____1. They take up the M.O.T.D. - I like joining servers to see ads.
____2. Rules Not Clear - Wait, you banned me for doing what?
____3. Banned for No Reason - Oh, right, banned for "Reason: Other."
__D. Administrators - Everyone hates them mainly because of their administrators.
____1. No Community - Admins do not aspire to create a community that invovles pubbers.
____2. Admins Do Everything - Admins do not want anyone other than themselves to try enforcing rules.
____3. Too Many Admins - So many admins causes things like favortism and knowing how to brown nose.
____4. No Consistency - Admins can ban you for whatever reason they like, as long as they can make it sound good enough.
____5. Admin Abuse - Admins abuse passively.
__E. Not a Family Organization - They claim to be, but they really aren't.
____1. "M" for Mature - Oh, so you have what age group playing games for 17-year olds?
____2. Borderline Porn in Sprays - Sure, no porn, but they have girls in bikinis as close as possible and even worse.

IV. Our Mission
Our Mission is to decay the popularity of =(eGO)=™ servers in a mature fashion, by protesting and expanding this group, until =(eGO)=™ presents itself as an honest, decent gaming organiztion.

Milestones
2009/08/05 - We began
2009/08/22 - 100 members
2009/09/04 - 200 members
2009/09/20 - 300 members
2009/11/05 - 500 members
2010/04/10 - 1000 members
2010/07/04 - 1250 members
2010/09/26 - 1500 members

group.headline: The finest group for hat wearing gentlemen
group.summary:
From the gentlemen at Valve:

''Throughout history, men have worn hats as a way of showing how much better they are than other men. “I buy hats,” a behatted man seems to say. “I am better than you.”

In wartime, hats were a useful way of conferring rank, and ensuring that casualties were confined to the lower classes (hence the famous command of “Don't fire till you see the tops of their heads” at the Battle of Bunker Hill by William Prescott, a general renowned for only shooting enemy combatants who were poor). During peacetime, hats have been instrumental for men to let the non-hatted know just who is wearing the hat around here.''

Join here to show your vast superiority, only if you own a hat. Otherwise you'll be recieved as a hat-less simpleton and you will be disgracefully kicked out until you legally own a hat.

group.headline: Counter Strike Source 2 Community Petition to Valve
group.summary:
Here are a few words from Valves Co-Founder Gabe Newell about Counter-Strike 2 in an interview with GameTrailers TV. After you read below I think you will agree its time for us Counter-Strike Source players to step up to the plate and send a message to Gabe Newell as well as take him up on some of the challenges he handed us, just read below and I think you will see where we as a community need to go with this!
“Gabe”
"I just don't think that [Counter-Strike 2] would be a good fit [with Half-Life Episode 3]," added Valve co-founder Gabe Newell, noting that the potential game would be a stand-alone product in his eyes.
As expected, the only thing confirmed about Counter-Strike 2 is that there is no Counter-Strike 2. However, Newell says that an e-mail to him with an "ordered list" of what sequels you want most may sway them. He personally would like to see a Portal 2 before a Counter-Strike 2. Newell closed with a dangerous challenge: "But if I get 15,000 emails from customers in response to this interview telling me 'Of course it should be in [the next Orange Box],' then of course we'll pay attention to that."
So, that being read lets send the man some email’s :) GabeN@valvesoftware.com
Valve could once more make Counter-Strike the foremost on-line game.

There is little more frustrating to the public than seeing a good idea badly executed. But it is something that competitive players of Counter-Strike: Source will already be able to tell you about at length should you wish to sit down and endure it.

The Counter-Strike format is two teams, both with their own set of goals, pitted against each other to complete them with a variety of weapons and tactics at their disposal, all set to a time limit.

The basic principles take seconds to learn, but the game itself can take the best part of a lifetime to master.

Counter Strike, still one of the most played games around the world
The best competitive 1.6 matches have attracted live audiences of tens of thousands, being spectated by hundreds of thousands worldwide and it didn't take long for CS:S to become the free gaming mod with the most number of players.

The Source of all the trouble:
Yet it is no secret that the port of Counter-Strike on to the Source engine brought about numerous problems, not the least of which was the huge divide in the competitive community.

There were numerous reasons for this and even though those that took the time to perfect Counter-Strike 1.6 would tell you it is simply that the newer version is a worse game that requires less skill – an argument that contains more than a grain of truth – the fact is that they are so very different it meant that in a lot of cases the only thing players would be bringing across with them would be their reputations.

As such there is no correlation between being hugely successful at 1.6 and Source.

group.headline: For those against the item drop system and other atrocities...
group.summary:
This group is also against the general drop system in use. Have a problem with it? Join the Dirty Idlers!

*IMPORTANT NOTICE!*
Let the record show. This group is not against every single wearer of halos...This group is againts what has been put against us and forced us to be branded as "vile cheaters" and such. And of course, we detest the fact that some halo wielders are taking the opportunity to rub it in our faces. So join the group if you wish. But please understand. We don't hate halos. We dislike the way we as a community (the dirty idlers) have been treated with no real warning.

Final Statement regarding the Idler Program...
We used the idler because we did not believe it to be a cheat. We used the idler because we DID want hats, but we couldn't have that opportunity 24/7. So we ended up using it whenever we were busy, AFK, at work or whatnot, when we were asleep. In other words... we used the idler when we could not play tf2. VALVe, however, decides that no matter the circumstances, they will just punish us PERIOD. No warning. No nothing. Just straight up wrath. It is part of the human nature to want such things that make themselves feel special. These hats are a prime example. Some of us in this community that did idle are actually quite avid gamers and fans of tf2. VALVe wanted to get rid of farming for items/achievements. Their answer? The (horrible) new "Random Drops" system and of course: Hats. Since we couldn't farm OR use skill...we had an answer. The Idler. We chose the Idler. That is all...for now....

-Drex

Micheal "Sober" Wood & Kevin "Hazey" Hodgkinson had a dream after playing competitive gaming together for years. Their goal was to build a place for gamers who wanted to play in tournaments, who wanted to read the latest gaming news, who wanted a home. Starting off small the two creative minds decided to start an organization and pick up teams who would represent Mobility-Gaming. Mobility-Gaming has grown from public servers to competitive FPS games to MMORPG's and the list goes on. Mobility-Gaming strides to become one of the top North American organizations with the goals we have reached, the plans that are in progress and the support we have. group.headline: We want Half-Life 2: Episode 3.
group.summary:
Hello, and welcome to 'We want Half Life 2: Episode 3'.

For those of you who did not know, this is a news oriented fan-based group. We post the latest updates on Half Life 2: Episode 3.

Now, there are a few things you should know about 'WWHL2EP3'

1st) This is not a boycott group. We (Or at least I) do not intend on delaying nor stopping the production of any other games VALVe will come out with in the mean time.

2nd) This group is supportive of VALVe, and we want it to be shown to them. This is like - say, a fan-base for the upcoming title.

3rd) This isn't an admin-only controlled group. If you feel like you have something interesting to say to the group you can post it in the comments section and I'll contact you. Nothing profane, rude, pushy or blatantly obvious (Use common sense) will be posted.

To show your support to VALVe I'd recommend inviting a few of your friends to the group so we can be seen.

Devoted group member (> - Fly! - <) [http://steamcommunity.com/id/user_fly/] posted instructions in the comments section on how to invite ALL your friends at ONCE.

He said:

"If you want to do like me, here's a little guide to inviting all the people on your friends list AT ONCE, so you don't have to go through a marathon of invitations (if you don't already know it by now):
In your steam-application OR on 'http://steamcommunity.com/', and go to "Community" (I sometimes have to login here again, )
Choose "Friends"
click "Select: All"
click "Actions: Invite Selected to Group"
choose "We want Half-Life 2: Episode 3!"
Done.
(Sample image if you're stuck: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/1467131/HowToInviteFriends.png )
Maybe the group then gets more attention and in best case your friends will ask you what this group is about.
To the people who don't know Half Life 2 series (respectively Half Life series), you can tell them about it and how great it is.
Cause it is (among other things) in fact THE cornerstone of the Left 4 Dead series and A cornerstone in gaming history.
To all the grumpy people who feel disturbed by being invited: Sorry, didn't want to wake you! Honestly!

Thanks
- Fly"


Enjoy the series for now, and have a great fall.
- Zemog.

------------------------------------------------------------

A big thanks to group members Russell, ad3_lina, Ooiman and Coffe, I must have it who wrote some great temporary descriptions while I wrote a big one.
Their descriptions can still be viewed in the comments here;

http://steamcommunity.com/groups/WeWantEp3/announcements/detail/199460461499975577

group.headline: X Ray Anti Cheat
group.summary:
AN ALL DEINE FREUNDE SENDEN !!!!!!! THX
WENN DU KEINE CHEATER BIST MUSST DIE GRUPPE UNBEDINGT HABEN xDD


Was ist X-ray?

X-ray ist ein Anti-Cheat Tool was in unregelmäßigen Abständen Screenshots vom Spiel aufnimmt und zwar genau das, was der Spieler sieht. Der Screenshot enthält neben der Sichtweise des Spielers auch Informationen zum Betriebssystem, der Hardware ID, sowie das Datum, wann der Screen erstellt wurde.Um X-Ray nutzen zu können ist ein Account auf http://www.xraygaming.com notwendig. . Nach erfolgter Anmeldung kann man den X-ray Client downloaden und benutzen. Die dafür benötigten Zugangsdaten sind die gleichen, die Ihr auch bei der Account Anmeldung benutzt habt.
X-Ray ist ein Anticheat Programm. Jeder Spieler muss die aktuellste X-Ray Version während des kompletten Spiels laufen lassen. Vor bzw. nach einem Match müssen selbstständig und ohne Aufforderung innerhalb von 24 Stunden die Links zum jeweiligen X-Ray Account als Matchreport dem Spiel hinzugefügt werden.
Sollte ein Spieler nachweislich in einem ESL-Match kein X-Ray eingesetzt haben, erhalten Spieler und Team 3 Strafpunkte(CoD:WW Ladders.). Ebenfalls ist ein Protest einzulegen. Bei einer Selbstanzeige kann keine Matchlöschung gefordert werden. Dieses Recht hat nur die gegnerische Partei. Ob ein Match gewertet wird, entscheidet der bearbeitende Admin.

Das manipulieren von Screenshots, die von X-ray erstellt wurden, ist verboten. Sollten manipulierte Screens als Matchmedia hochgeladen werden, wird dies mit bis zu 6 Strafpunkten für den Spieler und drei Strafpunkten für das Team geahndet.
Die aktuelle X-Ray Version findet ihr auf folgender Seite:
http://www.xraygaming.com/
Jeder Spieler hat in Eigenverantwortung dafür Sorge zu tragen, dass das Anti-Cheat-Programm X-Ray auf seinem System stets korrekt funktioniert.

Counter-Strike ist noch immer der beliebteste Online-Shooter aller Zeiten. Kaum jemand, der dieses Spiel nicht kennt oder gar selber regelmäßig mit Freunden im LAN oder online spielt. Aber auch kaum ein anderes Game wird von ebenso vielen Cheatern heimgesucht wie in CS. Über die Jahre hinweg haben sich einige Anti-Cheat-Tools diesem Problem angenommen und haben mit ihrer jeweiligen Funktionsweise einen gewissen Zeitraum für möglichst cheatfreies Spielen ermöglicht.
Ein Anti-Cheat-Tool ist ein Programm, das erkennen kann, ob ein Spieler im Multiplayer-Modus eines Computerspielers cheatet (mogelt), um so die Gegner leichter zu besiegen.

FÜR DIE WAHREN CSS SPIELER DIE NICHT CHEATEN UND X RAY BENUTZEN....

DU SPIELST CSS ? DU BIST VERDAMMT GUT ? ALLE LEUTE FLAMEN DICH VOLL DU BIST EIN CHEATER ? DANN REGESTRIERE DICH AUF X RAY ANTI CHEAT GAMING UND DOWNLOADE DIR DAS ANTI CHEAT TOOL !!!

SENDE ES AN ALL DEINE FREUNDE UND ES WIRD GANZ STEAM ÜBERNEHMEN !!!
CHEATER WERDEN AUSTERBEN !!
SEI DU AUCH GEGEN CHEATER
GIB DEN CHEATERN KEINE CHANCE !!!!!!!

group.headline: WE PWN !
group.summary: We rock hard and kick any bs thats out there a.k.a NEWBZ

[EN]

The Hat is a lie!
Many already have spent many hours behind favourite game, but as a result have not received any hat!

As a result hats those who literally has started to play recently (why?!) or those who days and nights sit on certain IDLE-servers stupidly without switching off the computer.

And the most surprising that the given system absolutely works on random, though you have 100 % of achievements, though you play from the date of game creation...
In general bosh.

So my friends, players Team Fortress, let's unite in the given group to endure this injustice at least together ;)

........................................................................................................................................................................................................................

[RU]

The Hat is a lie! - Шапка - это обман!
Уверен, что многие уже просидели энное кол-во часов за любимой игрой, но в итоге не получили даже и намёка на шапку!
В итоге шапками обладают те, кто буквально недавно начал играть (как так?!) или те, кто сутками на пролёт сидят на неких IDLE-серверах тупо не выключая компьютер.
И самое удивительное со стороны разработчиков, что вся данная система абсолютно работает на рэндоме (полной случайности в общем), хоть ты имей 100% выполненных достижений, хоть играешь со дня создания игры... всё равно жди "погоды у моря".
В общем чушь полнейшая.

Так что друзья мои, игроки Team Fortress, давайте объединимся в данной группе, чтобы переживать эту несправедливость хотя бы вместе ;)

P.s. - Так же нужно учитывать тот факт, что вся эта ситуация с шапками есть так называемый коммерческий ход. Поскольку новички шапки получают явно чаще бывалых игроков, что в последствие заинтересовывает их, а старички наигрывают лишние часы в надежде получить "заслужанное".
В общем разрабы ТФа удивляют порой :(

group.headline: The Official Seventh Hour Gaming Community!
group.summary:
Awesome Group With Awesome People!


Special Info: Recruit only respectable, Mature, Fun, Dedicated gamers! No rage quitters! :D

Background and History: Seventh Hour originally started in 2004 in Gamespy. The clan soon grew to higher standards. The clan at first was popular and well known for having 500+ members. The clan started playing and scrimming in games such as, Medal Of Honor Allied Assault(MOHAA) and, Counter Strike and, the original COD(Call of Duty). With the fall of Gamespy soon to come, the clan grew apart. Years later in 2008 the clan regrew and met up in World Of Warcraft. The clan grew to be a competitive guild which cleared PvE dungeons like crazy. We were also on top in the PvP charts. The clan soon fell apart due to the recent patch for the new expansion. This time however, I'm not aiming to recreate it as a clan, rather a large gaming community. The aim here is to regrow the long lost clan/guild into steam, and I know we can do it!


-Jenna

Die Zombie Apokalypse geht weiter und Left 4 Dead 2 (L4D2) ist der mit Hochspannung erwartete Nachfolger zum preisgekrönten Original Left 4 Dead, dem #1 Ko-Op-Game 2008.

In diesem ko-op-Action-Horror-FPS werden Sie und Ihre Freunde sich durch Städte, Sümpfe und Friedhöfe tief im Süden der USA kämpfen, von Savannah bis New Orleans, durch fünf ausgedehnte Kampagnen.

Als einer von vier Überlebenden, bewaffnet mit verheerenden, neuen und verbesserten, klassischen Waffen, können Sie nun auch die Zombifizierten im Nahkampf mit Kettensägen, Äxten und sogar tödlichen Bratpfannen aus dem Weg räumen.

Nutzen Sie diese Waffen gegen drei fürchterliche (und im Versus-Modus vorzügliche) Spezial-Infizierte. Sie werden auch bei den üblichen Zombies auf fünf neue Gestalten treffen, inklusive den furchteinflößenden Sumpfzombies.

Der AI Director 2.0 setzt neue Maßstäbe für das L4D-Gameplay des Originals. Dieser verbesserte Director kann nun die Wetterlage dem Spielgeschehen anpassen und ändert auch Spielpfade, Zombiepopulation, Effekte und Geräusche entsprechend Ihrem Können. L4D2 wird Ihnen bei jedem Spiel ein einzigartiges Spielerlebnis bieten und Ihnen die maßgeschneiderte Zombie-Apokalypse liefern.

group.headline: The Furry Hater's Creed
group.summary:
Obviously, furfags are a blight on the world. They sit around in their suits skullfucking each other whilst making weird animal noises and drawing art that even your mother wouldn't love. All furfags need to be rounded up and herded into camps, where they will be forced to build cheap TVs for the poor 20 hours a day. What they do for the other four hours is up to them. While they'll inevitably die of exhaustion, the survivors should have no problems consuming the bodies, as it's one of their fetishes, lulz.

Remember, just like witches and homosexuals, if you do not dedicate your life to end the existence of furries, you are one of them. Hence, the appropriate WH40K copypasta regarding the correct mindset when dealing with furries:

Kill them! Kill them! Kill them all!

As my Master told it me I now tell it thee that thou shalt tell others in thy turn.

In an internet of a million sites, what is the death of one site in the cause of purity? Some may question your right to destroy ten billion furfags. Those who understand realize that you have no right to let them live.

I hereby solemnly swear that I will do all I can to uphold the values of humanity, not insanity, as the cornerstone of any society.

To do this, I swear that I will not hesitate to destroy the Furries wherever they may stand or whomever they may be, nor will I back down from my duties.

I realize that their perversion is a black mark on humanity which cannot be wiped clean. It must be cut out entirely and destroyed as a cancer.

Just as the depravity of the Furry knows no bounds, nor shall my thirst for their permanent extermination.

I pledge that I will do all I can to obliterate the Furry fandom, and I swear that all the sick fucks who align themselves with said fandom will go with it into the fiery pits of hell.

And when I am finished, when my glorious task is done, when the last Furry on Earth has been obliterated into nothing more than a smear of sicko porn and fucked-up plush toy, I will rise and say “Look here. The deed is done.” And I will be exalted in glory eternally.

We at Frag Gaming are more than happy to have this Frag Gaming steam community group up to not only show our community about what's going on, but to help advertise our sponsors and help every affiliate with Frag Gaming grow. For those who do not know, Frag Gaming is a multi-gaming organization based off of intelligence and skill that each one of us plays. With each one of our divisions doing extremely well in leagues and with tournaments and lans coming up soon, Frag Gaming will soon be leading North America in eSports.

About Frag Gaming

Frag Gaming, a professional gaming organization founded in September of 2007, has been making a big dent in the world of eSports over the last year and gathering resounding support along the way. With paramount divisions in every major title from Call of Duty 4 to Gears of War, there's simply no other North American organization that matches the success and diversity of Frag Gaming.

When did eSports become such a big deal, anyway?

The industry of electronic sports has been growing exponentially over the last ten years. Small, local events rapidly grew into heavily sponsored international venues, providing a platform for the worlds finest to battle it out in front of cheering crowds for cold hard cash. Perhaps the biggest stride for the world of professional gaming came with a recent deal between Major League Gaming and ESPN, which will bring eSports to television sets all over the globe. Indeed, video games are becoming more and more accepted as a legitimate sport. North America once held the torch high, with organizations such as CompLexity and Team 3D competing internationally in the biggest competitive titles and making a living doing it. However, this torch has all but died out, with European and Asian teams beginning to appear more and more like unbeatable machines. America's finest competing on foreign soil has almost become a thing of the past, and what once was a shining beacon of discipline and ability has faded from notice..

group.headline: YouTube Poop
group.summary:
This group was created to honour the YouTube Poop video featuring the famous line "MY BOI!!!".



"YouTube Poop is a name used for videos posted on YouTube which are usually nonsensical and random. They are simply just randomly chosen clips from things such as cartoons, clipped, looped and remixed to make it sound really strange. The most commonly used clips include scenes from the CD-i game of The Legend of Zelda, and a Mario game called Hotel Mario. These particular YouTube Poop videos (or YTP) are popular among the internet-savvy people and are a major source of internet culture. Some of YTP is inspired by media shown on YTMND.com, such as the public service message given by Sonic the Hedgehog about being touched in uncomfortable places. The most popular source of clips would be from the Super Mario Bros. cartoon, episode called "Mama Luigi". The most used phrase from this episode would be "That's MAMA Luigi to you, Mario!"" - Urban Dictionary

group.headline: You maggots better win this war, you hear me!?
group.summary:
Now hear this, you blood-hungry sons of war!

As of oh-nine-hundred Eastern Standard time, we are at WAR with the DEMOMAN! That one-eyed bagpipe-playing sonofabitch has been a thorn in our collective sides for long enough! For THIS WEEK ONLY, each and every man brave enough to fight under the Soldier banner will be KILLING DEMOS!

Gentlemen, there comes a time in a man’s life when when HE MUST DRAW LINES! Friendship is FINE for tea parties and shopping trips to the dress store! But when the chips are down, a soldier puts ASIDE friendship for the good of WAR!

Every Demoman gutted, garroted, exploded or otherwise killed by a Soldier will mean a POINT for the Soldier Team! At the end of this week, when the points are tallied AND WE ARE FOUND TO HAVE MORE, we will be awarded an EXCLUSIVE ONE-OF-A-KIND WEAPON.

Gentlemen, I have NO IDEA what this weapon is. I don’t even know if I’ll WANT it. But BY GOD, I know what’s IMPORTANT, and it’s that WE get it and the DEMOMAN DOES NOT.

Am I understood? Then get out there and KILL!

Post how many god damn Black Scottish Cyclops we've managed to DESTROY so far.
